channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Big win for Kamala Harris camp: Ilhan Omar wins primary race in Minnesota
item.description: Ilhan Omar secured her primary win in Minnesota's 5th District against Don Samuels with a 56.2%-42.9% lead. Omar, part of the progressive 'Squad,' emphasized themes of housing and healthcare rights in her victory speech. Fundraising played a crucial role, with Omar raising $6.2 million compared to Samuels' $1.4 million. Omar will now face Republican Dalia Al-Aqidi.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Eric Hovde? Millionaire businessman who won Wisconsin's Senate GOP primary
item.description: Millionaire businessman Eric Hovde won the Wisconsin GOP Senate primary, defeating two minor candidates. He will now challenge Democratic Senator Tammy Baldwin in the upcoming election. Hovde, endorsed by former President Trump, aims to reduce costs, secure the border, and address healthcare issues. Baldwin portrays Hovde as a wealthy outsider out of touch with voters.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Biggest political corruption scandal': Hunter Biden sought US assistance in Burisma deal, says report
item.description: Hunter Biden reportedly sought help from the US Ambassador to Italy in 2016 to secure a deal for Burisma, a Ukrainian gas company where he was a board member, while his father was Vice President. The White House confirmed President Biden was unaware of this outreach. No meetings or projects materialized from Hunter Biden's requests.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Nasa astronaut shares timelapse video showing Moon setting behind Earth amid auroras
item.description: Nasa astronaut Matthew Dominick recently shared a captivating timelapse video from the International Space Station showing the moon setting amidst vibrant auroras. The video, captured with a new lens, highlighted the impact of recent solar eruptions. These geomagnetic storms have intensified, producing remarkable aurora displays. Dominick's footage has attracted significant attention, showcasing stunning visuals observed from 420 kilometers above Earth.
item.dc:creator: TOI Science Desk

item.title: After Kursk, Russia declares emergency in Belgorod amid increased Ukrainian attacks
item.description: Russian Belgorod governor Vyacheslav Gladkov declared a regional emergency after continuous Ukrainian attacks destroyed homes and caused civilian casualties. This move follows similar federal-level emergencies. Simultaneously, a Russian missile hit a Ukrainian shopping mall, resulting in numerous deaths and injuries, as the conflict between Russia and Ukraine persists since the February 2022 invasion.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Putin brings in his ex-bodyguard to counter Ukrainian incursion
item.description: President Putin appointed Alexey Dyumin, a trusted aide and former bodyguard, to oversee military and civilian operations in Russia’s Kursk region amid Ukraine’s incursion. Dyumin, recently named secretary of the State Council, is tasked with reporting back to Putin while reinforcements are sent to address the conflict. Ukraine’s incursion in Kursk is the biggest assault within Russia since 2022.

item.title: Tropical storm Ernesto likely to intensify into hurricane in Atlantic
item.description: Tropical Storm Ernesto is forecasted to strengthen into a hurricane, moving north of the Greater Antilles. It'll impact the Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, and Puerto Rico with substantial rainfall and potential storm surge. Puerto Rico remained under tropical storm warning with mobilized national guard and postponed public school classes for preparation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Japan's Kishida tells his ruling party he will not run in its September leadership vote, NHK says
'No tax on tips': Trump and Harris find common ground as a populist stance
item.description: In the US presidential campaign, Trump and Harris surprisingly agreed that workers' tips should not be taxed. While their populist proposal gained traction among service-sector workers, it faced criticism for economic irresponsibility. Economists argued it could create inequities among workers. The specifics remain unclear, but potential costs could exceed $107 billion over a decade.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Two toddlers found stranded on Texas highway after accident
item.description: A video of two toddlers in diapers wandering on a Texas highway after being ejected from a flipped car is circulating online. The accident occurred on Interstate 10 East Freeway, involving two vehicles. The toddlers and an adult were hospitalized but are in good condition. Authorities are investigating the crash that left the other driver uninjured.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US approves $20 billion weapons sale to Israel despite concerns
item.description: The Biden administration approved a $20 billion weapons sale to Israel despite activists' opposition due to Gaza's casualties. The state department announced 50 F-15 jets, tank cartridges, and military vehicles for Israel, emphasizing national security interests. Rescuers reported civilian deaths in Gaza from Israeli airstrikes, but the US did not confirm involvement of American-supplied arms.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Only Gaza ceasefire can delay Iran response to killing of Hamas chief by Israel: Report
Russia 'pauses' Ukraine's incursion; Kyiv says 74 areas in its control, but occupation not the goal
item.description: Russian forces repelled a Ukrainian attempt to further incursion in the Kursk region, halting armoured groups near several settlements. Kyiv stated the operation aimed to protect Ukraine from long-range attacks originating from Kursk. Ukraine's military commander reported control over 74 settlements and 40sqkm gained in the past day.

item.title: Trump flies on jet previously owned by Jeffrey Epstein
The University that made Kamala Harris
Kamala Harris worked at McDonald's, can you picture Trump doing it: Tim Walz
item.description: "Vice President Harris grew up in a middle class family and picked up shifts at McDonald’s. Can you picture Donald Trump working at a McDonald's trying to make a McFlurry or something? He couldn't run that damn McFlurry machine," Tim said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: JD Vance backed this startup: 'We had to work in 128-degree heat'
item.description: A JD Vance-backed startup is under the heat as former employees of the company have come out in the open complaining about the appalling working condition. The startup -- AppHarvest -- was an indoor farming hub to grow fruits and vegetables. JD Vance was a board member, an early investor and advocated for the app claiming that it was making a big difference in the world. CNN investigation found out that the working condition was terrible with the temperature reaching triple digit and the workers toiling.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: No science behind: Brazilian influencer's poop face mask draws flak from doctors
item.description: Brazilian influencer who previously went viral after applying period blood on her face as her skincare routine now literally put her sh*t on the face and said it worked for her skin. It was the craziest thing she did in her life but her skin was glowing, the 31-year-old influencer with 650,000 Instagram followers said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden says he would attend Trump inauguration if he wins: 'I have good manners'
item.description: President Joe Biden Tuesday said he would attend Donald Trump's inauguration in January in case the Republican presidential candidate wins this year's election. "I have good manners, not like him," Biden told reporters after being asked if he'd attend. Trump did not attend Biden's inauguration in 2021. It was the first time in over 150 years that the outgoing president skipped the new president's swearing in.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Is Barron Trump handling Donald's social media outreach team?
item.description: After Donald Trump's live stream with YouTuber Adin Ross where the former US president said that his youngest son Barron told him to come on Adin's livestreaming, speculations are rife whether 18-year-old Barron Trump is influencing father's social media game. DailyMail confirmed the speculations and said it's not only Barron but also his influencer friend Bo Loudon whom the president is listening a lot these days.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
